captions.text: More Than Surviving, Less Than Living

Following a rhythm even while brushing my teeth, 
flush the toilet and wash away tired suds from my face

Devoid of dreams, last night was dreamless,
the stranger in the mirror no longer dreams

Class bells turn into clocking in,
life is like a one way lane lost in the traffic

A steady, ordinary march,
living and obeying like a slogan that rhymes

For lunch I'll have whatever, anything's good,
and whatever you're having or any of the above

How strange it is that long ago I used to be opinionated,
with a stubborn heartbeat

No longer standing in the wind when heartbroken,
now I just fear catching a cold,
holding back someone and their demands day after day

Watch the sun rise and set, the moon wax and wane,
year after year passes,
see who has turned me into who I am now

Afraid of the tide rising and falling, afraid of what I will gain or lose, 
the pain of making mistake after mistake,
finally there is only survival left in my life
Living just to breathe, eat, and drink to stay alive

When I was young, I felt that the world was all mine
when I looked up at the sky framed by white clouds

I have more after growing up,
but why do I feel increasingly poorer and emptier?

That year, I pursued nothing but freedom, 
now all I can chase is the rising price of petrol

Does the earth have to quake until I fall 
from my home before regretting this sort of life?

Will the opposite of life be death or this sort of survival, 
with no more impulses

Shut my eyes and feel that life is speeding 
away from me by the minute, by the second

Lesser than an insect that can at least break the cocoon
and fly away towards the stolen sky, day after day

Watch the sun rise and set, 
the moon wax and wane, year after year passes,
see who has turned me into who I am now

Afraid of the tide rising and falling, afraid of what I will gain or lose, 
the pain of making mistake after mistake,
finally there is only survival left in my life
Living just to breathe, eat, and drink to stay alive
There are 365 days in a year, 525,600 minutes
There are 3,456,789,000 heartbeats in a lifetime
After being born for love, how should I spend my lifetime until I turn to smoke, day after day
until I turn to smoke, day after day

Watch the sun rise and set, the moon wax and wane, 
year after year passes, see who has turned me into who I am now
see who has turned me into who I am now

Afraid of the tide rising and falling, afraid of what I will gain or lose,
the pain of making mistake after mistake,
finally there is only survival left in my life
Living just to breathe, eat, and drink to stay alive

Watch the sun rise and set,
the moon wax and wane, year after year passes,
see who has turned me into who I am now

Afraid of the tide rising and falling, 
afraid of what I will gain or lose, the pain of making mistake after mistake,
finally there is only survival left in my life
Living just to breathe, eat, and drink to stay alive

Following a rhythm even while brushing my teeth, 
then set the alarm for 6:30AM tomorrow
More Than Surviving, Less Than Living

title: Mayday五月天[生存以上生活以下] HD MV官方完整版
